Query: Calculating the number of lines in a file?

so_2401997: exec 4<"file1"
while read -r line
do
    read -r s <&4
    echo "${line}-${s}" | bc
done <"file2"
exec >&4-

so_20270798: awk '
  /Start/ { start = $3 }      # 3rd field in line matching "Start"
  /End/ {
    end = $3;                 # 3rd field in line matching "End"
    print end - start         # Print the difference.
  }
' < file
